I'mI'm in the early stages of setting up a "hotel" on Minmus (off duty Kerbals need somewhere to chill and Snack between missions) and so I'm launching some large payloads. To stop the dreaded rocket wobble, I partly secure these loads with struts. Initially I used quite a few (remembering various Bridge Building games I've played) but, as time goes by, I'm finding I can get the job done with less and less. Is there a limit to the load a strut can take before breaking? Whenever something does break up in flight it always seems to be another part that fails first.

Edited October 4, 2015 by Clipperride
I've never had a problem with struts failing, and often 3 or 4 is plenty for whatever task I put them to, but idk if there is a limit of not.

Struts are quite strong, but so are most connections.

I like to think of connections as something tied down with a piece of string. That connection may be rather strong in the sense that you can dangle a lot of weight from it before it finally gives way, but it's not exactly rigid: no matter how hard you try to tie a tight knot, it will always have a little leeway.

The main benefit of struts is that they give you a second (third, whatever) attachment point. If you chose the attachment points right, you can make do with very few of them.

I suggest you look at truss bridges for inspiration. Engineers love triangles for a reason.

I don't think they break. They are overpowered by necessity. You are using less and less because you are learning to recognize key places where struts are important. The whole "Moar Struts" thing is funny, but realistically, spamming struts in current game versions is unnecessary if you know how to strategically place them (that wasn't always the case, there were versions where strut spamming was the only option)
Thanks for the answers. I use struts to try and eliminate stressing other joints the wrong way. With so little time in the atmosphere for most rocket flights, I'm happy to trade rigidity for drag

I couldn't tell you how strong they really are. I've had unacceptable flexing when I haven't used enough, so I just use more. The file says "150" for strength, I assume that's tons, since kg would be too weak, but tons seems to much also.

MODULE

{

name = CModuleStrut

linearStrength = 150

angularStrength = 150

}

I used probably over 300 struts in this Mun lander, and the rockets below it.

I made it for the Mun Rocked challenge, but failed in this attempt. Had to cheat with infinite fuel. Going to refuel it and see how it lands, then make some changes.

Edited October 4, 2015 by Wild Cobra
